<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	*
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Other operating expenses include selling, general and administrative expenses, bad debt expenses, severance and depreciation and amortization.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/07/26/0000866729-16-000030_MASTERSCHLREDBARLOGO.JPG" STYLE="HEIGHT:21PX;WIDTH:192PX;">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;28
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage31"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Fiscal 2016 compared to fiscal 2015
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Revenues for the fiscal year ended May 31, 2016 decreased by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$29.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$372.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	, compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$401.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;in the prior fiscal year. Total local currency revenues across the Company's foreign operations increased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$14.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;when compared to the prior fiscal year, but were offset by foreign currency exchange declines of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$43.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;as the U.S. dollar strengthened against most foreign currencies. Local currency revenues from Australia and New Zealand increased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$10.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	, primarily on increased sales of local titles within the Australia trade channel. Local currency revenues increased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$6.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;from the Company's Asia operations, primarily led by operations in Malaysia, India, and the Philippines. Local currency revenues from the UK increased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$2.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	, primarily due to an increase in book fairs channel revenues driven by the acquisition of Troubadour, Ltd., partially offset by lower sales within the trade and book clubs channels. Local currency revenue increases were partially offset by lower revenues in the Company's export and foreign rights channel of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$3.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	, reflecting the negative impact of the strengthened U.S. dollar. Lower local currency revenues in Canada of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$2.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;were due to the effect of the now settled labor action in Ontario schools.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Cost of goods sold for the fiscal year ended May 31, 2016 was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$194.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	52.2%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;of sales, compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$201.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	50.3%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;of sales, in the prior fiscal year. The increase in cost of goods sold as a percentage of revenues was primarily driven by the impact fixed costs had on the lower local currency sales in Canada. Additionally, the strong U.S. dollar further increased cost of goods sold as a percentage of revenues due to the fact that many of the Company's international operations purchase U.S. product in U.S. dollars. This increase was partially offset by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$1.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;in lower costs due to a warehouse optimization project in Canada during the prior fiscal year.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Other operating expenses decreased by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$9.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;when compared to the prior fiscal year. The decrease was primarily driven by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$16.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;in foreign exchange translation, partially offset by a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$3.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;insurance settlement in the prior fiscal year relating to a fire in a warehouse in India and a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$1.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;increase in bad debt expense due to economic conditions in Malaysia and Thailand. Other operating expenses were also impacted by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$0.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$1.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;of the severance expenses for the fiscal years ended May 31, 2016 and 2015, respectively, related to cost saving initiatives.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Segment operating income for the fiscal year ended May 31, 2016 was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$11.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	, compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$20.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;in the prior fiscal year. The decrease was driven by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$3.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;in foreign exchange translation, higher cost of goods sold due to U.S. sourced product, a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$3.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;insurance settlement in the prior fiscal year relating to a fire in a warehouse in India, a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$1.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;increase in bad debt expense due to economic conditions in Malaysia and Thailand, lower revenues from the Canadian operations and lower gross margin sales in the Australian channels. This was partially offset by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$2.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;in impairment charges of certain outdated technology platforms in the prior fiscal year,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$1.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;in lower costs due to a warehouse optimization project in Canada during the prior fiscal year and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$0.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;in lower severance costs in fiscal 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Fiscal 2015 compared to fiscal 2014
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Revenues for the fiscal year ended May 31, 2015 decreased by $12.2 million to $401.2 million, compared to $413.4 million in the prior fiscal year. Total local currency revenues across the Company's foreign operations increased $7.5 million, but were offset by foreign currency exchange declines of $19.7 million as the U.S. dollar strengthened against most foreign currencies. Local currency revenues from the Asian operations increased $6.4 million due to improved revenues from trade and from the direct sales channel across the region. Local currency revenues from the major markets of Canada, the United Kingdom and Australia increased $0.2 million on the strength of trade and book fairs channel results and increased sales of media products in Australia, partially offset by lower revenues from the Company&#8217;s Canadian operations. The lower local currency revenues in Canada were due in part to decreased revenues from book club operations, including the impact of a teachers' strike in British Columbia. Revenues from the Company&#8217;s export and foreign rights operations in the U.S. increased $0.9 million, as the Company continues to serve markets globally via this channel.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Cost of goods sold for the fiscal year ended May 31, 2015 was $201.7 million, or 50% of sales, compared to $202.7 million, or 49% of sales, in the prior fiscal year. The modest increase in cost of goods sold as a percentage of sales was primarily due to $1.5 million of increased costs in Canada for a warehouse optimization project and the higher cost of U.S. dollar-denominated product.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Other operating expenses decreased by $4.1 million when compared to the prior fiscal year. The decrease was primarily due to foreign currency exchange rates coupled with lower promotional and salary related costs and a $3.7 million insurance settlement relating to a fire in a warehouse in India, partially offset by $1.5 million in severance costs as part of cost reduction and restructuring programs.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/07/26/0000866729-16-000030_MASTERSCHLREDBARLOGO.JPG" STYLE="HEIGHT:21PX;WIDTH:192PX;">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;29
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage32"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Certain outdated technology platforms resulted in $2.7 million in impairment charges in fiscal 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Segment operating income for fiscal 2015 decreased by $9.8 million to $20.6 million, compared to $30.4 million in the prior fiscal year. The decrease was driven by $2.7 million in impairment charges of certain outdated technology platforms, $1.5 million of increased costs in Canada for the warehouse optimization project and $1.5 million in severance costs as part of cost reduction and restructuring programs, coupled with lower revenues from the Canadian operations and lower gross margin sales in the Australian channels, partially offset by the $3.7 million insurance settlement relating to the fire in a warehouse in India.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Overhead
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Fiscal 2016 compared to fiscal 2015
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Corporate overhead for fiscal 2016 decreased by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$14.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$107.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	, compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$121.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;in the prior fiscal year. The decrease primarily relates to lower unabsorbed overhead burden, as costs in fiscal 2016 have been offset by transition service fees under the transition services agreement with the purchaser of the educational technology and services business, and lower pension expense of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$4.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;related to a settlement on a portion of the domestic pension plan in the prior fiscal year. The decrease was partially offset by higher strategic technology spending on new enterprise-wide customer and content management systems and the migration to SaaS and cloud-based technology solutions and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$4.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;in higher impairment charges associated with a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$7.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;pretax impairment charge related to the abandonment of legacy building improvements in connection with the Company's renovation of its headquarters location in New York City, compared to a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$2.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;impairment charge in fiscal 2015 associated with the closure of the retail store located at the Company headquarters in New York City. Corporate overhead expenses were also impacted by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$8.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$7.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;of severance expenses related to cost saving initiatives for the fiscal years ended May 31, 2016 and 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Fiscal 2015 compared to fiscal 2014
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Corporate overhead for fiscal 2015 increased by $39.4 million to $121.7 million, compared to $82.3 million in the prior fiscal year, primarily reflecting higher strategic technology spend on enterprise-wide management platforms and higher depreciation expense on the Company's corporate headquarters building acquired in fiscal 2014. The higher enterprise-wide technology spend reflected in overhead was partially offset by lower business unit-specific spend reflected in the segment results, primarily in the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Children&#8217;s Book Publishing and Distribution
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;segment. Included in overhead expenses were unallocated overhead costs that would have been charged to the educational technology and services business of $15.8 million and $16.2 million in fiscal 2015 and 2014, respectively, severance expenses as part of cost reduction and restructuring programs of $7.4 million and $9.3 million in fiscal 2015 and 2014, respectively, pension settlement charges of $4.3 million and $1.7 million in fiscal 2015 and 2014, respectively, and a $2.9 million impairment charge in fiscal 2015 associated with the closure of the retail store located at the Company headquarters in New York City.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage33"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	restricted cash held in escrow of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$34.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	, the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$33.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;in cash used in investing activities associated with the former educational technology and services business before it was sold, the release of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$24.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;in restricted cash in the current fiscal year and a working capital adjustment resulting in a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$2.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;final payment.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Cash provided by financing activities was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$12.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;for the fiscal year ended May 31, 2016, compared to cash used in financing activities of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$124.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;for the prior fiscal year, representing an increase in cash provided by financing activities of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$136.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	. The Company experienced lower net repayment activity under the Loan Agreement of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$120.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;and higher proceeds pursuant to employee stock plans of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$19.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	, and the Company's short-term net borrowings position resulted in an increase in cash provided of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$11.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	. This increase was partially offset by an increase in the Company's repurchase of common stock of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$10.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Fiscal 2015 compared to fiscal 2014
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Cash provided by operating activities was $166.9 million for the fiscal year ended May 31, 2015, compared to cash provided by operating activities of $156.8 million for the prior fiscal year, representing an increase in cash provided by operating activities of $10.1 million. Changes in operating assets and liabilities resulted in a $47.0 million increase in cash provided by continuing operations, driven by improved collections of receivables and higher revenues from book clubs operations, where cash collections are generally contemporaneous with the sale of product. Discontinued operations also contributed a $7.0 million increase in cash provided by operating activities driven by the former educational technology and services business which was sold on May 29, 2015. Earnings from continuing operations increased by $2.2 million over the prior year. The increases were partially offset by decreased adjustments to reconcile earnings from continuing operations to net cash provided by operating activities of continuing operations of $46.1 million, including lower depreciation and amortization of $13.3 million, decreased asset impairments of $12.2 million and lower deferred income taxes of $12.4 million.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Cash provided by investing activities was $445.3 million for the fiscal year ended May 31, 2015, compared to cash used in investing activities of $345.7 million for the prior fiscal year, representing an increase in cash provided by investing activities of $791.0 million. The increase was primarily driven by the sale of the former educational technology and services business on May 29, 2015, which resulted in cash proceeds of $543.2 million comprised of the proceeds of $577.7 million less restricted cash held in escrow of $34.5 million. Also contributing to the increase was the prior fiscal year purchase of the land and building comprising the leased portion of the Company&#8217;s New York City corporate headquarters, located in SoHo, for $253.9 million. This was partially offset by a $3.2 million increase in use of cash from investing activities in discontinued operations driven by the former educational technology and services business.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Cash used in financing activities was $124.5 million for the fiscal year ended May 31, 2015, compared to cash provided by financing activities of $122.5 million for the prior fiscal year, representing a decrease in cash provided by financing activities of $247.0 million. The decrease was primarily driven by a $120.0 million repayment under the Company's Loan Agreement during fiscal 2015 compared to $120.0 million of borrowings outstanding in fiscal 2014, which resulted in a decrease of $240.0 million. The decrease was also attributable to net loan repayments of $9.0 million in fiscal 2015 compared to net borrowings of $13.9 million in the prior fiscal year, contributing to a decrease of $22.9 million. This was partially offset by higher proceeds pursuant to employee stock plans of $14.8 million.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Due to the seasonal nature of its business as discussed under &#8220;Seasonality&#8221; above, the Company usually experiences negative cash flows in the June through October time period. As a result of the Company&#8217;s business cycle, borrowings have historically increased during June, July and August, have generally peaked in September or October, and have been at their lowest point in May. In fiscal 2016, the Company had substantial tax payment related to the gain on the sale of the educational technology and services business. The Company does not expect to incur significant domestic borrowings to meet operating needs in fiscal 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The Company&#8217;s operating philosophy is to use cash provided by operating activities to create value by paying down debt, reinvesting in existing businesses and, from time to time, making acquisitions that will complement its portfolio of businesses or acquiring other strategic assets, as well as engaging in shareholder enhancement initiatives, such as share repurchases or dividend declarations. During the fiscal year ended May 31, 2016, the Company purchased $14.4 million of Company shares on the open market compared to $3.5 million of share purchases in the prior fiscal year.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The Company has maintained, and expects to maintain for the foreseeable future, sufficient liquidity to fund ongoing operations, including working capital requirements, pension contributions, dividends, currently authorized common share repurchases, debt service, planned capital expenditures and other investments. As of May 31, 2016, the Company&#8217;s primary sources of liquidity consisted of cash and cash equivalents of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$399.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	, cash from operations, and funding available under the Loan Agreement totaling approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$425.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	. Additionally, the
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/07/26/0000866729-16-000030_MASTERSCHLREDBARLOGO.JPG" STYLE="HEIGHT:21PX;WIDTH:192PX;">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;31
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage34"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Company has short-term credit facilities of $48.3 million, less current borrowings of $6.3 million and commitments of $4.9 million, resulting in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$37.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;of current availability at May 31, 2016. The Company may at any time, but in any event not more than once in any calendar year, request that the aggregate availability of credit under the Loan Agreement be increased by an amount of $10.0 million or an integral multiple of $10.0 million (but not to exceed $150.0 million). Accordingly, the Company believes these sources of liquidity are sufficient to finance its ongoing operating needs, as well as its financing and investing activities.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">

<EFX_MARKET_RISK>
<A NAME="FIS_MARKET_RISK"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Item 7A | Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures about Market Risk
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The Company conducts its business in various foreign countries, and as such, its cash flows and earnings are subject to fluctuations from changes in foreign currency exchange rates. The Company sells products from its domestic operations to its foreign subsidiaries, creating additional currency risk. The Company manages its exposures to this market risk through internally established procedures and, when deemed appropriate, through the use of short-term forward exchange contracts which were not significant as of May 31, 2016. The Company does not enter into derivative transactions or use other financial instruments for trading or speculative purposes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The Company is subject to the risk that market interest rates and its cost of borrowing will increase and thereby increase the interest charged under its variable-rate debt.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Additional information relating to the Company&#8217;s outstanding financial instruments is included in Note 4 of Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements in Item 8, &#8220;
</FONT>
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;" HREF="#SCHL5312016-10K_HTM_SB6E0FF04C6FC699BC77853735990A7C6">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Consolidated Financial Statements and Supplementary Data
</FONT>
</A>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	,&#8221; which is included herein.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>

<BR>
</DIV>

</DIV>

	The following table sets forth information about the Company&#8217;s debt instruments as of May 31, 2016 (see Note 4 of Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements in Item 8, &#8220;Consolidated Financial Statements and Supplementary Data&#8221;):
</FONT>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_13"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<DIV STYLE="PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;PADDING-TOP:10PX;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">
<TR>
<TD COLSPAN="32">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:27%;">
</TD>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-TOP:1PX SOLID #000000;">

	$

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:8.5PT;">

	1,257.6
</FONT>
</DIV>

</DIV>

</EFX_STOCKHOLDERS_EQUITY>

<EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	(Amounts in millions, except share and per share data)
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="SCHL5312016-10K_HTM_S2BE2E2026356CB1AD1FF537329E44E9C">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	1. DESCRIPTION OF THE BUSINESS, BASIS OF PRESENTATION AND SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Description of the business
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Scholastic Corporation (the &#8220;Corporation&#8221; and together with its subsidiaries, &#8220;Scholastic&#8221; or the &#8220;Company&#8221;) is the world&#8217;s largest publisher and distributor of children&#8217;s books, a leading provider of print and digital instructional materials for Pre-K to grade 12, and a producer of educational and entertaining children&#8217;s media. The Company creates quality books and ebooks, print and technology-based learning materials and programs, classroom magazines and other products that, in combination, offer schools customized and comprehensive solutions to support children&#8217;s learning both at school and at home. Since its founding in 1920, Scholastic has emphasized quality products and a dedication to reading and learning. The Company is the leading operator of school-based book clubs and book fairs in the United States. It distributes its products and services through these proprietary channels, as well as directly to schools and libraries, through retail stores and through the internet. The Company&#8217;s website, scholastic.com, is a leading site for teachers, classrooms and parents and an award-winning destination for children. Scholastic has operations in the United States ("U.S."), Canada, the United Kingdom ("UK"), Australia, New Zealand, Ireland, India, China, Singapore and other parts of Asia and, through its export business, sells products in more than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	150
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;countries.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Basis of presentation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Principles of consolidation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The Consolidated Financial Statements include the accounts of the Corporation and all wholly-owned and majority-owned subsidiaries. All significant intercompany transactions are eliminated in consolidation. Certain reclassifications have been made to conform to the current year presentation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Discontinued operations
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The Company closed or sold several operations during fiscal 2015. During the fourth quarter of fiscal 2015, the Company sold its educational technology and services business, which, among other things, was engaged in the development and sale of technology-based reading and math improvement programs, as well as providing consulting and professional development services. Additionally during fiscal 2015, the Company completed a restructuring of the businesses comprising its former
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Media, Licensing and Advertising
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	segment, including discontinuing its Soup2Nuts animation and audio production studio operations and Scholastic Interactive, as well as the print edition of a periodic consumer magazine.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	All of these businesses are classified as discontinued operations in the Company&#8217;s financial statements for all periods presented.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Use of estimates
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The Company&#8217;s Consolidated Financial Statements have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States. The preparation of these financial statements involves the use of estimates and assumptions by management, which affects the amounts reported in the Consolidated Financial Statements and accompanying notes. The Company bases its estimates on historical experience, current business factors, and various other assumptions believed to be reasonable under the circumstances, all of which are necessary in order to form a basis for determining the carrying values of assets and liabilities. Actual results may differ from those estimates and assumptions. On an on-going basis, the Company evaluates the adequacy of its reserves and the estimates used in calculations, including, but not limited to:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:132PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;PADDING-LEFT:60PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Accounts receivable reserves for returns
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>

	Sales taxes
</FONT>
</DIV>

	Royalty advance reserves

	Customer reward programs
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;PADDING-LEFT:60PX;">
