<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The only voting rights vested in the holders of Common Stock, except as required by law, are the election of such number of directors as shall equal at least one-fifth of the members of the Board. The Class A Stockholders are entitled to elect all other directors and to vote on all other matters. The Class A Stockholders and the holders of Common Stock are entitled to one vote per share on matters on which they are entitled to vote. The Class A Stockholders have the right, at their option, to convert shares of Class A Stock into shares of Common Stock on a share-for-share basis. With the exception of voting rights and conversion rights, and as to any rights of holders of Preferred Stock if issued, the Class A Stock and the Common Stock are equal in rank and are entitled to dividends and distributions, when and if declared by the Board.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Preferred Stock
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The Preferred Stock may be issued in one or more series, with the rights of each series, including voting rights, to be determined by the Board before each issuance. To date,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;shares of Preferred Stock have been issued.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Stock-based awards
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	At May 31, 2016, the Company maintained two stockholder-approved stock-based compensation plans with regard to the Common Stock: the Scholastic Corporation 2001 Stock Incentive Plan (the &#8220;2001 Plan&#8221;), under which no further awards can be made; and the Scholastic Corporation 2011 Stock Incentive Plan (the &#8220;2011 Plan&#8221;). The 2011 Plan was adopted in July 2011 and provides for the issuance of incentive stock options; non-qualified stock options; restricted stock; and other stock-based awards. On September 24, 2014, the stockholders approved an amendment to the 2011 Plan increasing the shares available for issuance pursuant to awards granted under the 2011 plan by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	2,475,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;shares.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The Company&#8217;s stock-based awards vest over periods not exceeding four years. Provisions in the Company&#8217;s stock-based compensation plans allow for the acceleration of vesting for certain retirement-eligible employees, as well as in certain other events.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">

</FONT>

	&#32;shares of Common Stock were outstanding under the 2001 Plan and the 2011 Plan, respectively. During fiscal 2016,

	461,322

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The Company also maintains the 1997 Outside Directors Stock Option Plan (the &#8220;1997 Directors Plan&#8221;), a stockholder-approved stock option plan for outside directors under which no further awards may be made. The 1997 Directors Plan, as amended, provided for the automatic grant to each non-employee director on the date of each annual stockholders&#8217; meeting of non-qualified stock options to purchase
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	6,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;shares of Common Stock. At May 31, 2016, options to purchase
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	12,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;shares of Common Stock were outstanding under the 1997 Directors Plan.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	In September 2007, the stockholders approved the Scholastic Corporation 2007 Outside Directors Stock Incentive Plan (the &#8220;2007 Directors Plan&#8221;). From September 2007 through September 2011, the 2007 Directors Plan provided for the automatic grant to each non-employee director, on the date of each annual meeting of stockholders, of non-qualified stock options to purchase
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	3,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;shares of Common Stock at a purchase price per share equal to the fair market value of a share of Common Stock on the date of grant and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	1,200
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;restricted stock units. In July 2012, the Board approved an amended and restated 2007 Outside Directors stock incentive Plan (the &#8220;Amended 2007 Directors Plan&#8221;), which was approved by the stockholders in September 2012. The Amended 2007 Directors Plan provides for the automatic grant to each non-employee director, on the date of each annual meeting of stockholders, of stock options and restricted stock units with a value equal to a fixed dollar amount. Such dollar amount, as well as the split
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/07/26/0000866729-16-000030_MASTERSCHLREDBARLOGO.JPG" STYLE="HEIGHT:21PX;WIDTH:192PX;">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;61
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage64"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	of such amount between stock options and restricted stock units, will be determined annually by the Board (or committee designated by the Board) in advance of the grant date. The value of the stock option portion of the annual grant is determined based on the Black-Scholes option pricing method, with the exercise price being the fair market value of the Common Stock on the grant date, and the value of the restricted stock unit portion is the fair market value of the Common Stock on the grant date. In July 2015, stock options and restricted stock units with a value of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	seventy thousand
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;dollars for each non-employee director, with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	40%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;of such value in the form of options and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	60%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;in the form of restricted stock units, were approved, and, on September 21, 2015, an aggregate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	12,033
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;options at an exercise price of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$43.56
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;per share and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	6,748
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;restricted stock units were granted to the non-employee directors under the Amended 2007 Directors Plan.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	In December 2015, the Board approved an amendment to the Amended 2007 Directors Plan to provide that a non-employee director elected between annual meetings of stockholders would receive a grant at the time of such election equal to a pro rata portion of the most recent annual grant of stock options and restricted stock units, based on the number of regular Board meetings remaining to be held for the annual period during which such election occurred. As a result of such amendment,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	1,464
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;stock options at an exercise price of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$41.05
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;per share and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	818
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;restricted stock units were granted to a newly-elected director on December 16, 2015 under the Amended 2007 Directors Plan.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	As of May 31, 2016,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	150,891
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;options were outstanding under the Amended 2007 Directors Plan and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	241,841
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;shares of Common Stock remained available for additional awards under the Amended 2007 Directors Plan.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The Scholastic Corporation 2004 Class A Stock Incentive Plan (the &#8220;Class A Plan&#8221;) provided for the grant to Richard Robinson, the Chief Executive Officer of the Corporation as of the effective date of the Class A Plan, of options to purchase Class A Stock (the &#8220;Class A Options&#8221;). As of May 31, 2016, there were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	500,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;Class A Options granted to Mr. Robinson outstanding under the Class A Plan, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;shares of Class A Stock remained available for additional awards under the Class A Plan.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Generally, options granted under the various plans may not be exercised for a minimum of one year after the date of grant and expire approximately ten years after the date of grant. The intrinsic value of these stock options is deductible by the Company for tax purposes upon exercise. The Company amortizes the fair value of stock options as stock-based compensation expense over the requisite service period on a straight-line basis, or sooner if the employee effectively vests upon termination of employment for certain retirement-eligible employees, as well as in certain other events.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The following table sets forth the intrinsic value of stock options exercised, pretax stock-based compensation cost and related tax benefits for the Class A Stock and Common Stock plans for the fiscal years ended May 31:
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Pretax stock-based compensation cost is recognized in Selling, general and administrative expenses. As of May 31, 2016, the total pretax compensation cost not yet recognized by the Company with regard to outstanding unvested stock options was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$3.3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	. The weighted average period over which this compensation cost is expected to be recognized is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	2.0 years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	. In fiscal 2016, there were no stock-based compensation costs recognized in discontinued operations. In fiscal 2015 and 2014, stock-based compensation cost included
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$2.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$0.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;of expenses, respectively, recognized in discontinued operations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">

</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">

</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Restricted Stock Units
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#8211; In addition to stock options, the Company has issued restricted stock units to certain officers and key executives under the 2011 Plan (&#8220;RSUs&#8221;). The RSUs automatically convert to shares of Common Stock on a one-for-one basis as the award vests, which is typically over a four-year period beginning thirteen months from the grant date and thereafter annually on the anniversary of the grant date. There were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	61,924
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;shares of Common Stock issued upon vesting of RSUs during fiscal 2016. The Company measures the value of RSUs at fair value based on the number of RSUs granted and the price of the underlying Common Stock on the grant date. The Company amortizes the fair value of outstanding Stock Units as stock-based compensation expense over the requisite service period on a straight-line basis, or sooner if the employee effectively vests upon termination of employment under certain circumstances.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The following table sets forth the RSU award activity for the fiscal years ended May 31:
</FONT>
</DIV>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	As of May 31, 2016, the total pretax compensation cost not yet recognized by the Company with regard to unvested RSUs was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$2.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	. The weighted average period over which this compensation cost is expected to be recognized is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	1.6 years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Management Stock Purchase Plan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	- The Company maintains a Management Stock Purchase Plan (&#8220;MSPP&#8221;), which allows certain members of senior management to defer up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	100%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;of their annual cash bonus payments in the form of restricted stock units (&#8220;MSPP Stock Units&#8221;) which are purchased by the employee at a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	25%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;discount from the lowest closing price of the Common Stock on NASDAQ on any day during the fiscal quarter in which such bonuses are payable. The MSPP Stock Units are converted into shares of Common Stock on a one-for-one basis at the end of the applicable deferral period. The Company measures the value of MSPP Stock Units based on the number of awards granted and the price of the underlying Common Stock on the grant date, giving effect to the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	25%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;discount. The Company amortizes this discount as stock-based compensation expense over the vesting term on a straight-line basis, or sooner if the employee effectively vests upon termination of employment under certain circumstances.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The following table sets forth the MSPP Stock Unit activity for the fiscal years ended May 31:
</FONT>
</DIV>

</FONT>

	$0.1

	The total fair value of shares vested during the fiscal years ended May 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014 was

	$5.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Employee Stock Purchase Plan
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The Company maintains an Employee Stock Purchase Plan (the &#8220;ESPP&#8221;), which is offered to eligible United States employees. The ESPP permits participating employees to purchase Common Stock, with after-tax payroll deductions, on a quarterly basis at a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	15%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;discount from the closing price of the Common Stock on NASDAQ. In fiscal 2012, the ESPP was amended to provide that the purchase of Common Stock occurs on the last business day of the calendar quarter. The Company recognizes the discount on the Common Stock issued under the ESPP as stock-based compensation expense in the quarter in which the employees participated in the plan.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The following table sets forth the ESPP share activity for the fiscal years ended May 31:
</FONT>
</DIV>

<TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	(48.5
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Remaining Board authorization at May 31, 2016
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">

	45.5
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;TEXT-INDENT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;PADDING-RIGHT:48PX;">
	(a)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Represents the remainder of a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	$200.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;authorization after giving effect to the purchase of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	5,199,699
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;shares at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	$30.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#32;per share
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-LEFT:4PX;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	pursuant to a large share repurchase in the form of a modified Dutch auction tender offer that was completed by the Company
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-LEFT:4PX;TEXT-INDENT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	on November 3, 2010 for a total cost of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	$156.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	, excluding related fees and expenses.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-LEFT:4PX;PADDING-LEFT:48PX;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	On July 22, 2015, the Board authorized an additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$50.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;for the share buy-back program, to be funded with available cash. During the twelve months ended May 31, 2016, the Company repurchased approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	0.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;shares on the open market for approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$14.4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;at an average cost of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$34.75
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;per share. The Company&#8217;s repurchase program may be suspended at any time without prior notice.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	On December 16, 2015, the Board approved another modified Dutch Auction tender offer (the "Offer") to purchase for cash up to $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	200.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;in value of the Company's shares of Common Stock, par value,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$.01
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;per share, at a price range to be determined. The Offer was commenced on December 28, 2015 with a price range for prices specified by tendering stockholders of not greater than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$40.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;per share or less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$37.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;per share of Common Stock. On January 21, 2016, the Company terminated the Offer because of a decrease of more than 10% in a number of major United States stock indices following the commencement of the Offer on December 28, 2015. One of the conditions of the Offer provided the Company with the right in its discretion to terminate the Offer in the event of a decrease of more than
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/07/26/0000866729-16-000030_MASTERSCHLREDBARLOGO.JPG" STYLE="HEIGHT:21PX;WIDTH:192PX;">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;64
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage67"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	10%, at any time prior to the expiration of the Offer, in the market price for the Common Shares or in the Dow Jones Industrial Average, New York Stock Exchange Index, NASDAQ Composite Index or the Standard and Poor's 500 Composite Index measured from the close of trading on December 28, 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="SCHL5312016-10K_HTM_S800CECDF5003904522F053732E9EB84E">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	13. EMPLOYEE BENEFIT PLANS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Pension Plans
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The Company has a cash balance retirement plan (the &#8220;U.S. Pension Plan&#8221;), which covers the majority of United States employees who meet certain eligibility requirements. The Company funds all of the contributions for the U.S. Pension Plan. Benefits generally are based on the Company&#8217;s contributions and interest credits allocated to participants&#8217; accounts based on years of benefit service and annual pensionable earnings. The U.S. Pension Plan is a defined benefit plan. It is the Company&#8217;s policy to fund the minimum amount required by the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as amended. Effective June 1, 2009, no further benefits will accrue to employees under the U.S. Pension Plan.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Scholastic Ltd., an indirect subsidiary of Scholastic Corporation located in the United Kingdom, has a defined benefit pension plan (the &#8220;UK Pension Plan&#8221;) that covers its employees who meet various eligibility requirements. Benefits are based on years of service and on a percentage of compensation near retirement. The UK Pension Plan is funded by contributions from Scholastic Ltd. and its employees.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The Company&#8217;s pension plans have a measurement date of May 31.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Post-Retirement Benefits
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The Company provides post-retirement benefits to eligible retired United States-based employees (the &#8220;Post-Retirement Benefits&#8221;) consisting of certain healthcare and life insurance benefits. Employees may become eligible for these benefits after completing certain minimum age and service requirements. Effective June 1, 2009, the Company modified the terms of the Post-Retirement Benefits, effectively excluding a large percentage of employees from the plan. At May 31, 2016, the Company had
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;unrecognized prior service credit.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement and Modernization Act (the &#8220;Medicare Act&#8221;) introduced a prescription drug benefit under Medicare (&#8220;Medicare Part D&#8221;) as well as a Federal subsidy of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	28%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;to sponsors of retiree health care benefit plans providing a benefit that is at least actuarially equivalent to Medicare Part D. The Company has determined that the Post-Retirement Benefits provided to its retiree population are in aggregate the actuarial equivalent of the benefits under Medicare Part D. As a result, in fiscal 2016, 2015 and 2014, the Company recognized a cumulative reduction of its accumulated post-retirement benefit obligation of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$3.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$3.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$3.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	, respectively, due to the Federal subsidy under the Medicare Act.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The following table sets forth the weighted average actuarial assumptions utilized to determine the benefit obligations for the U.S. Pension Plan and the UK Pension Plan (collectively the &#8220;Pension Plans&#8221;), including the Post-Retirement Benefits, at May 31:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_43"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;WIDTH:100%;BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:8%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:8%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:1%;">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:8%;">
</TD>

</TD>

<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="8" STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Pension Plans
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="8" STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Post-Retirement Benefits
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2016
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	To develop the expected long-term rate of return on assets assumption for the Pension Plans, the Company considers historical returns and future expectations. Considering this information and the potential for lower future returns due
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/07/26/0000866729-16-000030_MASTERSCHLREDBARLOGO.JPG" STYLE="HEIGHT:21PX;WIDTH:192PX;">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;65
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage68"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	to a generally lower interest rate environment, the Company selected an assumed weighted average long-term rate of return of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	4.7%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The following table sets forth the change in benefit obligation for the Pension Plans and Post-Retirement Benefits at May 31:&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	In fiscal 2015, the Company recognized a pretax charge of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$4.3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	, related to the lump sum settlements of certain U.S. pension obligations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The following table sets forth the net funded status of the Pension Plans and Post-Retirement Benefits and the related amounts recognized on the Company&#8217;s Consolidated Balance Sheets at May 31:

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The estimated net loss for the Pension Plans that will be amortized from Accumulated other comprehensive loss into net periodic benefit cost over the Company&#8217;s fiscal year ending May 31, 2017 is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$1.8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	. The estimated net loss for the Post-Retirement Benefits that will be amortized from Accumulated other comprehensive loss into net periodic benefit cost over the fiscal year ending May 31, 2017 is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$2.4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	. Income tax benefit of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$1.8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	, income tax benefit of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$2.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;and income tax expense of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$5.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;were recognized in Accumulated other comprehensive loss at May 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>

	Components of net periodic (benefit) cost:

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Net periodic (benefit) cost
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	On May 31, 2016, the Company changed the approach used to measure service and interest costs for pension and other postretirement benefits. The Company previously measured service and interest costs utilizing a single weighted-average discount rate derived from the yield curve used to measure the plan obligations. The Company has now elected to measure service and interest costs by applying the specific spot rates along that yield curve to the plans&#8217; liability cash flows. The Company believes the new approach provides a more precise measurement of service and interest costs by aligning the timing of the plans&#8217; liability cash flows to the corresponding spot rates on the yield curve. This change does not affect the measurement of the Company's plan obligations. The Company has accounted for this change as a change in accounting estimate and, accordingly, has accounted for it on a prospective basis. There is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;impact on interest and service cost for pension and other post-retirement benefits, respectively, in fiscal 2016 due to the change in methodology.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Plan Assets
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The Company&#8217;s investment policy with regard to the assets in the Pension Plans is to actively manage, within acceptable risk parameters, certain asset classes where the potential exists to outperform the broader market.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;67
</FONT>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>

<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:8PT;PADDING-LEFT:0PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	(1)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Funds which invest in a diversified portfolio of publicly traded U.S. common stocks of large-cap, medium-cap and small-cap companies. There are no restrictions on these investments.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

	(2)
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">

</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	Represents assets of a non-U.S. entity plan invested in a fund whose underlying investments are comprised of properties. The fund has publicly available quoted market prices and there are no restrictions on these investments.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The Company has purchased annuities to service fixed payments to certain retired plan participants in the UK.&#160;These annuities are purchased from investment grade counterparties.&#160;These annuities are not traded on open markets and are therefore valued based upon the actuarial determined valuation, and related assumptions, of the underlying projected benefit obligation, a Level 3 valuation technique.&#160;The fair value of these assets was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$5.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$6.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;at May 31, 2016 and May 31, 2015, respectively.&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">

	The Company implemented cost reduction and restructuring programs in fiscal 2016, recognizing severance expense of

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$9.5

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;70
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The amounts reclassified out of Accumulated other comprehensive income (loss) were recognized in Selling, general and administrative expense.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage74"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Earnings from continuing operations exclude earnings of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$0.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$0.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$0.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;for the years ended May 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively, for earnings attributable to participating RSUs.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	In a period in which the Company reports a discontinued operation, Earnings (loss) from continuing operations is used as the &#8220;control number&#8221; in determining whether potentially dilutive common shares are dilutive or anti-dilutive. There were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	0.3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;million potentially anti-dilutive shares outstanding pursuant to compensation plans as of May 31, 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	A portion of the Company&#8217;s RSUs granted to employees participates in earnings through cumulative non-forfeitable dividends payable to the employees upon vesting of the RSUs. Accordingly, the Company measures earnings per share based upon the lower of the Two-class method or the Treasury Stock method.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Options outstanding pursuant to compensation plans were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	3.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	4.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;as of May 31, 2016 and 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	As of May 31, 2016,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$45.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;remains available for future purchases of common shares under the current repurchase authorization of the Board of Directors.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	See Note 12, &#8220;Treasury Stock,&#8221; for a more complete description of the Company&#8217;s share buy-back program.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">

</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="SCHL5312016-10K_HTM_S4537FB556F0CBBA822B4537334D52ECA">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	19. DERIVATIVES AND HEDGING
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The Company enters into foreign currency derivative contracts to economically hedge the exposure to foreign currency fluctuations associated with the forecasted purchase of inventory and the foreign exchange risk associated with certain receivables denominated in foreign currencies. These derivative contracts are economic hedges and are not designated as cash flow hedges. The Company marks-to-market these instruments and records the changes in the fair value of these items in current earnings, and it recognizes the unrealized gain or loss in other current assets or
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/07/26/0000866729-16-000030_MASTERSCHLREDBARLOGO.JPG" STYLE="HEIGHT:21PX;WIDTH:192PX;">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;72
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage75"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	liabilities. The notional values of the contracts as of May 31, 2016 and 2015 were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$31.8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$19.7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	, respectively. Net unrealized losses of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$0.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;and unrealized gains of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$0.3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;were recognized at May 31, 2016 and May 31, 2015, respectively. These amounts are reported in Selling, general and administrative expenses.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="SCHL5312016-10K_HTM_S3AAE21F40AA12099DC10537334E43444">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	20. FAIR VALUE MEASUREMENTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The Company determines the appropriate level in the fair value hierarchy for each fair value measurement of assets and liabilities carried at fair value on a recurring basis in the Company&#8217;s financial statements. The fair value hierarchy prioritizes the inputs, which refer to assumptions that market participants would use in pricing an asset or liability, based upon the highest and best use, into three levels as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:40PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;PADDING-LEFT:16PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Level 1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;Unadjusted quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities at the measurement date.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-LEFT:40PX;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:40PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;PADDING-LEFT:16PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Level 2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;Observable inputs other than unadjusted quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities such as
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-LEFT:40PX;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:120PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;PADDING-LEFT:96PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#9702;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Quoted prices for similar assets or liabilities in active markets
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:120PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;PADDING-LEFT:96PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#9702;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Quoted prices for identical or similar assets or liabilities in inactive markets
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:120PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;PADDING-LEFT:96PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#9702;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Inputs other than quoted prices that are observable for the asset or liability
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:120PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;PADDING-LEFT:96PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#9702;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Inputs that are derived principally from or corroborated by observable market data by correlation or other means
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:40PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;PADDING-LEFT:16PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Level 3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;Unobservable inputs in which there is little or no market data available, which are significant to the fair value measurement and require the Company to develop its own assumptions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	The Company&#8217;s financial assets and liabilities measured at fair value consisted of cash and cash equivalents, debt and foreign currency forward contracts. Cash and cash equivalents are comprised of bank deposits and short-term investments, such as money market funds, the fair value of which is based on quoted market prices, a Level 1 fair value measure. The Company employs Level 2 fair value measurements for the disclosure of the fair value of its various lines of credit. The fair value of the Company's debt approximates the carrying value for all periods presented. For a more complete description of fair value measurements employed, see Note 4, &#8220;Debt.&#8221; The fair values of foreign currency forward contracts, used by the Company to manage the impact of foreign exchange rate changes to the financial statements, are based on quotations from financial institutions, a Level 2 fair value measure. See Note 19, &#8220;Derivatives and Hedging,&#8221; for a more complete description of fair value measurements employed.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Non-financial assets and liabilities for which the Company employs fair value measures on a non-recurring basis include:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:40PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;PADDING-LEFT:16PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	Long-lived assets
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</TD>
</TR>

	Investments
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>

</TD>

</TD>
</TR>
<TR>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;PADDING-LEFT:16PX;">

	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">

	Assets acquired in a business combination
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</TD>

</TD>

</DIV>

	Level 2 and Level 3 inputs are employed by the Company in the fair value measurement of these assets and liabilities. For the fair value measurements employed by the Company for goodwill, see Note 8, &#8220;Goodwill and Other Intangibles." For the fair value measurements employed by the Company for certain property, plant and equipment, production assets, investments and prepublication assets, the Company assessed future expected cash flows attributable to these assets.

<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="SCHL5312016-10K_HTM_S6DFC57AE3F0F27A4DE57537336142FE3">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	21. SUBSEQUENT EVENTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	On July 20, 2016, the Board of Directors declared a regular cash dividend of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	$0.15
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;per Class A and Common share in respect of the first quarter of fiscal 2017. The dividend is payable on September 15, 2016 to shareholders of record on August 31, 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	On July 20, 2016, the Board of Directors approved the termination of the U.S. Pension Plan, in which all benefit accruals were previously frozen as of June 1, 2009. Based on the Plan&#8217;s current funded status and the frozen benefit, it was determined that the on-going costs of maintaining the Plan were growing at a greater rate than the benefit delivered to the Company&#8217;s employees and former employees. An application will be filed with the IRS for an advance determination as to whether the Plan meets the qualification requirements of Internal Revenue Code section 401(a). Upon approval of the IRS and the Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation, the assets of the Plan will be distributed either via a lump sum payment to each deferred vested participant or to another qualified retirement plan established on the participant's behalf, or via an annuity contract underwritten by an insurance company. All participants currently receiving a periodic benefit will continue to receive their benefit payments without disruption.&#160;The Company expects that the process for terminating the pension plan, which involves several regulatory steps and approvals, will take
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	18
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	24
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;months.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/07/26/0000866729-16-000030_MASTERSCHLREDBARLOGO.JPG" STYLE="HEIGHT:21PX;WIDTH:192PX;">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#32;74
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND STOCKHOLDERS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	OF SCHOLASTIC CORPORATION
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 700,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:15PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	We have audited the accompanying consolidated balance sheets of Scholastic Corporation as of May 31, 2016 and 2015, and the related consolidated statements of operations, comprehensive income (loss), changes in stockholders&#8217; equity, and cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended May 31, 2016. Our audits also included the financial statement schedule listed in the Index at Item 15(c). These financial statements and schedule are the responsibility of the Company&#8217;s management. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these financial statements and schedule based on our audits.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:15PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	We conducted our audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement.&#160;An audit includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in the financial statements. An audit also includes assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall financial statement presentation. We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:15PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	In our opinion, the financial statements referred to above present fairly, in all material respects, the consolidated financial position of Scholastic Corporation at May 31, 2016 and 2015, and the consolidated results of its operations and its cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended May 31, 2016, in conformity with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles. Also, in our opinion, the related financial statement schedule, when considered in relation to the basic financial statements taken as a whole, presents fairly in all material respects the information set forth therein.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:15PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	We also have audited, in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States), Scholastic Corporation&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting as of May 31, 2016, based on criteria established in Internal Control-Integrated Framework issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (2013 framework), and our report dated July 26, 2016 expressed an unqualified opinion thereon.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	/s/ Ernst &amp; Young LLP&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	New York, New York
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:MUSEO SANS 300,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:9.5PT;">
	July 26, 2016
</FONT>
</DIV>
